validated_claims.evidence: Claim aligns with documented calculation procedures. Formula (total monthly salary / actual working days) is consistent across multiple source references.
Multiple Jira tickets (TSSD-1807, TSSD-4464) reference working days calculations that exclude public holidays. Procedure documentation confirms holiday subtraction in calculation steps.
Navigation path 'Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation' is documented in navigation_paths array and referenced in multiple procedures.
Multiple sources confirm three calculation bases: calendar days, working days, and custom days. Referenced in claim_id 'calculation_basis_001' and procedure 'Daily Wage Calculation'.
Navigation path 'Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation' exists in navigation_paths with context 'Accessing salary proration configuration'.
Three calculation bases (custom days, calendar days, working days) confirmed across multiple data points including procedures and navigation contexts.
Procedure 'Update Salary Proration' confirms immediate effect on active payroll: step includes 'If payroll month is open, reject existing prorated salary transactions'.
Jira ticket TSSD-2648 documents this override behavior. Claim consistent with limitation claim 'payroll_configuration_precedence'.
Jira tickets TSSD-1581 and TSSD-4368 document failure to recalculate deductions when salary configurations change after leave request submission.
Jira ticket TSSD-4179 documents system using 365 days instead of 366 for 2024 leap year, causing gratuity calculation discrepancy of AED 17.26.
Jira ticket TSSD-2605 documents decimal precision errors in daily wage calculations producing amounts 0.1-0.2 lower than expected.
Jira ticket TSSD-4742 documents gratuity calculation difference (AED 231,821.10 vs AED 252,485).
Jira ticket TSSD-1625 documents inconsistent handling of February 29th causing 1-day difference in service days (912 vs 913 days).
Jira ticket TSSD-2252 documents complex gratuity calculation logic with precise day counting and leap year division by 366.
Jira ticket TSSD-2043 documents extra day in tenure calculation (623 vs 622 days) and fixed 30-day divisor differing from client's preferred formula.
Jira ticket TSSD-4731 documents fixed policy configuration causing misalignment with user expectations about calendar days.
Jira ticket TSSD-3648 documents monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual due to varying working days per month.
Jira ticket TSSD-2321 documents independent configurations using different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days).
Jira ticket TSSD-4292 documents user misunderstanding of work week configuration with all 7 days as working days. System was correct.
Jira ticket TSSD-3058 documents failure to prorate salary correctly when departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date.
Jira ticket TSSD-2532 documents duplicate deductions when daily wage calculation changes after transaction submission. Deleting leave request doesn't remove payroll deductions.
Jira ticket TSSD-4464 documents synchronization issue between Time Off and Payroll modules when public holidays added after leave request creation.
Jira ticket TSSD-1301 documents incorrect display of 31 days instead of 29 days for February despite correct underlying calculation.
Jira ticket TSSD-1753 documents global configuration overriding policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods, causing gross salary usage instead of basic salary.
Jira ticket TSSD-1807 documents display of daily rate from payroll month (May) instead of leave occurrence month (April). Actual deduction correct but display confusing.
Jira ticket TSSD-4905 documents inability to dynamically adjust salaries based on actual working days.
Jira ticket TSSD-2648 confirms payroll daily wage calculator automatically overrides leave policy formula.
Jira ticket TSSD-1581 confirms unpaid leave deductions depend on timing of salary configuration relative to leave request.
Jira ticket TSSD-4179 confirms system defaults to 365 days, failing to recognize 366 days in leap years.
Jira ticket TSSD-2605 confirms formula (basic + allowances) / 30 may not produce precise pro-rated amounts.
Jira ticket TSSD-4742 confirms leave days only accrued at month-end, preventing prorated inclusion for mid-month departures.
Jira ticket TSSD-1625 confirms unclear methodology for counting service days including leap year handling.
Jira ticket TSSD-2252 confirms lack of clear documentation for gratuity calculation methodology.
Jira ticket TSSD-2043 confirms fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30) that cannot be modified.
Jira ticket TSSD-4731 confirms fixed policy configuration that cannot be easily overridden.
Jira ticket TSSD-3648 confirms leave encashment daily wage calculated based on working days per month.
Jira ticket TSSD-2321 confirms separate configurations for leave salary and salary proration with different divisors.
Jira ticket TSSD-4292 confirms daily wage proration tied to configured work week including 7-day work weeks.
Jira ticket TSSD-3058 confirms salary proration only works for past departure dates, not future dates.
Jira ticket TSSD-2532 confirms inability to automatically reconcile leave transactions with payroll deductions.
Jira ticket TSSD-4464 confirms formula: (basic salary + allowance) / working days excluding weekends and public holidays.
Jira ticket TSSD-4464 confirms Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to Payroll module.
Jira ticket TSSD-4368 confirms fixed 30.42 days divisor for unpaid leave deductions.
Jira ticket TSSD-1301 confirms daily wage calculations use actual calendar days which vary by month.
Jira ticket TSSD-1753 confirms global configuration supersedes policy-level settings.
Jira ticket TSSD-1807 confirms formula: (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays.

summary: Validated 117 claims for daily wage calculator feature. All claims show high logical consistency with source documentation. Navigation paths confirmed via documented procedures. Jira-sourced claims (known issues, limitations, customer requests, edge cases, troubleshooting procedures) validated through ticket correlation. Zendesk-sourced claims (calculation rules, system behavior, UI steps, navigation) validated through procedure documentation and navigation path verification. No claims require UI execution for validation - all assessments based on logical consistency analysis of input documentation.
